intro: Nesaea erecta f. villosa, commonly known as the hairy erect nesaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy foliage, which gives it its specific epithet "villosa." The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
